alert.note: Alert for Monterey; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 5:59AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Watsonville, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Corralitos, Pacific Grove, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Castroville, Boronda, Moss Landing, Del Monte Forest, Prunedale, Freedom, Interlaken, Amesti, Del Rey Oaks, Sand City and Elkhorn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
